inn1.comm: he starts with a pretty wide one ...
much better, just outside off stump and Trescothick lets it go safely by
drifting down the leg side, cannons off pads for an easy leg bye
that one topped 90mph and flew through Strauss ... half appeal from Shoaib
hammers Strauss on the pads and shouts of "that's close" from the entire team here!  Replays indicate that we were right and Billy Doctrove was wrong
clever slower ball, dug out by Strauss
again sliding down the leg side and Strauss misses an attempted flick and it hits him on the pads. A great over to start with
drifting down the leg and lobs out off pad to square leg for an easy leg bye
started wide of the off stump and got wider... Akmal sprawled to his left and just about stopped it
better line outside off stump
improvement lasted one ball ...
pitched up, straight drive down ground - first runs off the bat
Trescothick takes two steps down the track and pushes into the covers for a well-run single
back into the grove
straight, easily blocked. A better end to a poor over
short into the body and it plops behind square on the leg. Shoaib is averaging 90.1mph so far
flicked straight to midwicket
slightly wide but Strauss smacks it straight to cover point
dropped the ball unconvincingly into the ground and it spun back into the stumps quite hard as Strauss spun round to see where it was ... but the bails stayed on! A rueful smile from Akhtar
guided just wide of midwicket
defended off the back foot but a no-ball anyhow
Trescothick turned square and the ball flew at catchable height through where third slip would have been - Inzamam only has two slips - for four.  Shoaib could have had both openers in that over
Strauss aimed a rather ambitious flick over square leg but the shot was indecisive and the ball lobbed high to Afridi who barely had to move. It wasn't really short enough for the stroke he played
short into the body and a tickle from Trescothick helps the ball on its way down to the fine-leg boundary
good ball which had Trescothick in several minds
left alone outside off stump
a touch short outside off but the ball took off and was taken high above his head by Akmal
unconvincing push into his pad and Trescothick called him for a quick single even though the ball barely went a yard. Good running. Shoaib appears to be limping.
off pads and dribbled down the leg where Akmal gathered. More distress signals from Shoaib
Trescothick leaves alone and then holds the pose for the photographers. Shoaib's limp gets worse ...
wide outside the off stump. Shoaib pulls a few faces indicating he is in pain ... that could just be to excuse the delivery
into Trescothick's body and jabbed into the leg. Shoaib's pace remains undiminished

lovely ball angled across the left-hander and Trescothick definitely played and missed. Shoaib walking to third man like he was aged 70. The physio is waiting for him at the rope, assuming he ever makes it that far
driven through the covers. Shoaib has stopped 15 yards from the boundary leaving the physio looking rather lost, rather like the pimply boy at the school disco
better line, left alone
and again
Shoaib talking to the physio but staying just out of reach. He's clearly not right but seems determined to stay on
clipped behind square on the leg and thoughts of a single quashed by a quick pick-up
driven between cover and extra cover, in the air but quite safe
defensive punch through extra cover
played down firmly into the pitch
blocked into the covers. Shoaib looks fine when running in but in discomfort more than real pain the rest of the time
straight and short
edged wide of the two slips for a second time, but there is a third man to save the boundary
effective tip and run as Bell drops the ball at his feet and runs. Good communication between the two batsmen. Shoaib leaves the field ...
yorker length but outside the off stump and blocked
outside off and an expansive leave
played down but uncontrolled, but good call from Trescothick means they get a single as the ball rolls a few yards behind square
good running ... more than half the singles so far have not gone more than a few yards form the bat
left alone
wide loosener driven through the covers but pulls up juts short of the rope
a hint of swing
played into covers, quick yell of no from Trescothick  as Bell pondered a single
proded to cover who races in to prevent the single
left alone outside off stump
driven firmly off his legs to mid on
same shot, same result

short and wide of off stump and Trescothick plays a horrible scythe from outside leg   with feet rooted, aiming to slash the ball over cover, but only gets a thin edge to Akmal. Both openers have now fallen to poor shots
flamboyant leave outside off
another leave, this time on length as the ball passed harmlessly over the top of off stump
that would have been a wide ... but Bell slashed and the ball flew high to Younis Khan at second slip. However, the ball punches through his outstretched hands for four
great ball, left Bell and beat him all ends up
steered down to third man all along the ground
clipped into the space wide of midwicket
Mohammad Asif  is bowling wide of off stump and jagging the ball back in to Pietersen
that cut back and hit Pietersen on the thigh, hard enough to trundle into the covers for a leg bye
clever stuff. Bell gets down the striker's end and Mohammad Asif bowls him one that leaves him
straighter and Bell forced to block
left alone
short of a length and cleverly guided down to third man off the back foot
the bowler rushes through on his follow-through and Pietersen shoulders arms
huge swing and that one bends away from the righthander, ever so close to shaving his outside edge. Great ball
again that one is very accurate and that hurries past the outside edge; he's probing away outside off stump here a treat
poor cricket - although a decent ball. The batsman is squared up and a huge outside edge flies low in front of second slip who misses it completely and it flies through for four
carved away in front of  point, a top shot
wide and left
good line and Pietersen opting for circumspection so far
Pietersen comes ambling down the pitch and is hit for his pains as Mohammad Asif  sees him coming and digs one in

lovely bowling. Mohammad Asif bowls one just short of a length, Pietersen , who only got half forward, gets a thick outside edge and Akmal takes a routine catch to his right. A reward for some really classy and intelligent bowling and for the second time in three days England are wobbling
Bell jabbed firmly at that and was beaten
the most convincing shot so far - short and Bell onto it quickly and launched it through midwicket
angled behind square and an athletic  diving stop by Younis Khan at second slip
this time he found the gap and two to third man
straight into his groove. Umbrellas back down but it looks to be a brief respite
moved back into the right-hander and blocked
aimed to cover drive, but the ball squirted off the inside edge down to long leg
steered to the left of cover
short, Collingwood rocked back and slapped it one-bounce behind square on the leg for four
Nice comeback, Collingwood started to play but pulled out of the defensive prod just in time
misfield in the covers
Shoaib has now found his line and pace
super ball, that. angled in at 90mph and Bell sparred at thin air
slightly short, hit on the top of the bounce through the covers
on a length and just outside the off stump of Collingwood who comes forward to defend
pushed off the back foot into the leg side, no run there
good length again, nice and full from Razzaq and Collingwood can only defend this
Collingwood goes back into his crease and plays this with a crooked bat
a very solid forward defensive from Collingwood, with a resounding "clunk" of the bat
excellent end to the over as this slightly wider delivery squares Collingwood up who squirts it, quite safely, to point
defended off the back foot, Collingwood - alert and eager as ever - tries to scamper through for a run before Bell wisely sends him back
neatly timed off the back foot but straight to mid-off. He really does look

yowzers! Shoaib's slower ball comes out all wrong (for once) and it balloons over Bell's head. That's a terrifying delivery - clearly not intentional from Shoaib - but the umpire rightly warns him nevertheless
lovely shot! He really climbed into that, driving it with a flourish on the front foot but again straight to a shortish mid-off
excellent line from Shoaib on middle-and-off with just a hint of away swing. Bell defends it with a straight bat off the back foot
fabulous shot as Bell square cuts with immense power, timing it quite beautifully through cover point. That zinged across the outfield like a tracer
shorter delivery - slower, too (73mph) - and Bell jumps back into his crease, defending it on his toes. Well, not on his toes you understand...with his bat, obviously
outside the off stump on a good length and Collingwood ignores it, eyeing the ball and pitch very studiously
a touch straighter on off stump this time, forcing Collingwood who blocks it out
he pushes this out into the covers but the length is again perfect, and he takes it nearly on the splice of the bat
fine shot as Collingwood chips this over the infield down to deep midwicket
defended solidly
Bell goes back to defend this but it hurries onto him and he chips it ungainly into the leg side
lovely length again, in the corridor of uncertainty and Bell shuffles outside his off stump to defend
just a touch fuller this time from Rana and the batsman comes forward to defend, screaming "no" to his non-striker
cut with power on the tips of his toes off the back foot but straight to cover
a bit of shape away from the right hander who squirts this into the covers
punched to cover
batsman tries to push this into the leg side but he is outdone by a bit of away swing, the ball hitting the pad
and again Collingwood gets into a tangle, but it was too straight to threaten the outside edge
too straight this time and Collingwood works him to leg for a single
outside the off stump but Razzaq oversteps here
ooh good line outside the off stump, but Bell adjusts nicely to angle it into the gully
crikey that's close! Razzaq cuts this back into Collingwood and it's clearly out but the umpire disagrees. Perhaps going over the stumps but...he's a bit lucky, to say the least
lovely away swing from Rana, gently shaping away from the right hander who nevertheless adjusts well
Bell chips this with an angled bat past the bowler, but without any power
Rana was probably hoping that would boom away from the right hander, but it was wide of his leg stump and called as such
fine shot. Rana's slower ball is well read from Bell who crunches it straight, just wide of mid-off, for a fluent four
another attempted slower ball which comes out as a full bunger, Bell again picks it and hammers it over midwicket for another four.
defended on the front foot
better line forcing the defensive shot off the back foot
neatly played by Collingwood, intelligent batting as he opens the face and runs this down to third man
but this time Razzaq pitches it just slightly fuller and Bell can only defend it
down the leg side, Bell misses out here. That was a gimme for four down to fine leg
timed off the back foot to short midwicket, no run there
ooh superb ball angling back into the right hander who is beaten, the ball bobbling out into the covers. Super ball, that, and they run a leg-bye
down the leg side, a non-turner from Afridi and Bell rather misses out here. That was another gimme
short, wide and cut to deep extra cover and there's his fifty. He acknowledges the subdued crowd's applause with a solemn
outside off and defended on the front foot. Not much turn there
drifting into Collingwood who comes forward, the ball turns enough and raps him on the pad and Afridi roars an appeal. That's about as plum as a rather large plum from a big plum tree in Plumshire
quicker ball! Afridi's great to watch, and this drifts into the right hander who plays it neatly to leg
pushed without great power to mid-on and they walk a single
outside the off stump, miles too wide but not called a wide by the umpire
better line and length, Dalrymple defends on the front foot. No turn here for Hafeez
a cracker, drifting away from Dalrymple's meek prod forward and passing the outside edge
pushed out into the covers and they walk a single, the fielder half asleep there
crunched and well timed but straight to long off and they can only grab a single
turns away from the right hander but it's too shot, and he is cut to deep point
lovely ball on off stump and turning away, defended on the front foot
too full and chipped down the ground very neatly
short this time, and wide, allowing the batsman plenty of time to cut it off the back foot
ooh the quicker one, but somehow Afridi oversteps and it's a no ball. How do spinners ever over step
pushed for a single down to long-on
neatly bowled outside off stump, drifting away from the right hander who punches it wide of gully
defended on the front foot
once again solidly defended. Hafeez bowling very slowly here
clunked down to long-on
outside off stump and cut off the back foot
defended off the back foot once more
Dalrymple pushes forward and clunks this back to the bowler
well bowled! Shorter, it hurries onto the right hander and Dalrymple just can't get him away
tries to pull this but misses, Akmal fumbles it behind the stumps
cut, but no run
premeditated sweep behind square and that's just a single
stops on an off drive
down leg but that's tidily scooped by Akmal
pulls out of a cover-drive this time
drives that one out to long-off
waits for that one and helps it to third man where it's misfielded by Shoaib Akhtar. That's the first four from seven overs
pitches on leg, the batsman waits for it and helps it off the hips into midwicket
right on a good length and that's dug out well, with Dalrymple rehearsing his flick off the hips
this time he flicks that one into midwicket for a quick single
just short of a length and the batsman tries to rush that one out to point but stops on the shot
ooh, interesting. That's right up there and Bell can only get bat on it at the last minute as it keeps low and he has to readjust
chipped out to midwicket
slides that one to midwicket
tight bowling again, this one is right up there and that's defended on the front foot
strays down leg and that's paddled through square
on the money and that's defended forward
"Good bowling," cries Akmal and it was - right up there and the batsman can only defend
squeezed out just in front of point; a fumble by the fielder but there's no extra run to be had
another tidy delivery to finish off another decent over
guides that one off the backfoot to cover
brings his bat down beautifully on that one but only finds a fielder at cover
pushed right up and it's defended
worked off the front foot into midwicket
comes down to meet that one and squirts it down off the bottom of his bat out to extra cover
defended
nurdled off the back foot into midwicket
rocks back on to his back foot but defends. Tidy stuff from the bowler
tries a sweep, goes down on one knee for it, but pulls out of the shot
clipped off his front foot, aiming for midwicket, but it goes straighter than he had expected, to long-on
defended
defended again
doesn't get hold of that one and it drops into short midwicket
waits for one which pitches on leg and that goes to midwicket
a sweep and there's a loud appeal but the umpire doesn't signal leg-bye, suggesting it got a small edge
lovely shot, cut off the back foot and it's collected by the sweeper
keeps low and that's forced to mid-on
oh, that hurts. A low, sharp return chance is shelled by Afridi who jabs his fingertips on it. Shouts of "Catch it" are in vain
worked to long-off for a languid single
swept to the man at deep backward square leg
doesn't get hold of that attempted sweep to the 45
well bowled again, that's defended
paddled away to fine leg
worked to the man sweeping on the leg-side
pitched right up and the batsman can do no more than squeeze it to long-off
pushes the batsman on to his backfoot
hits with the drift and lifts that to cow corner where it bounces once
late cut, very nice indeed, using the pace and bisecting two fielders. This is Bell's highest one-day score - can he convert to a ton?
worked off his backfoot to square
offspinner to finish the over and that's chopped down, late and fine
squirted out to the cover boundary
worked off the backfoot to mid-on where it's not fielded properly and the batsmen take a run
doesn't get hold of that one which pitches outside off and is played off the back foot
helped down to mid-on and they lazily jog a single
played to square
premeditated reverse sweep but that's good fielding, pinged back quickly
ooh, a thick edge evades Akmal - it's just too wide for him. That was the attempted offcutter and the batsman drove at that
cleverly played, controlled down to short third man
waits for that and strikes the ball firmly off the back foot, cutting away to deep point
comes forward, gets over it and works that one to midwicket
waited again and paddle-drives to mid-on
worked off the back foot and that's misfielded at midwicket
swing and a miss
again, the batsman fails to get hold of that and it veers dangerously near to his edge - good bowling
works that out to mid-on
reverse sweep played just in front of the batsman's face
left alone
late cut rolls gently backwards of point
whipped away off the legs and that goes to deep backward square leg
Great ball first up on his return. Dalrymple swooshes at that one and it whizzes past his outside edge at 86mph. Top bowling
strays down leg and that's worked behind square. That one was 84mph
banged in short and that's a cracker of a shot, played down off the back foot
attempted slower one, but it's a low full toss wide of the off stump. The batsman can't capitalise however, and that's just worked to the fielder on the third man boundary

direct hit from mid-on. Lightning fielding - a quick two-handed pickup from Afridi and he shies down the stumps, great piece of fielding. The batsman wasn't hurrying and in the end he was way out - no third umpire required here

top yorker, you don't get better, totally cleaned up. That one was fired in at 92mph, have some of that. England have now lost two wickets in two balls and they're in some trouble, with two new men at the crease. Great change from Inzamam and that's Shoaib's 200th wicket in one-dayers.
speared in and that's defended first up
more defence as the batsman sets about playing himself in
defended again, this is good bowling
off the mark with a squeeze to mid-on
came forward and squeezed that to mid-off

Read was walking off as soon as he played that shot. The batsman was looking to work it on the on-side, but instead he gets a leading edge and that's snapped up well by the bowler, taken low with a commando roll to finish
walks across his stumps and plays that off middle and off, right back through fine leg. That was bowled at 92mph and the batsman only had to get bat on that for it to be whipped away
defended off the back foot
speared in right at the batsman again and that's well defended on the front foot; good bowling, too.
bouncer and the batsman ducks right under it
slower ball and the batsman can't quite work that round to square
cleverly whipped to mid-on but just for one
defended
improvised straight drive off the backfoot
a mere whip off the legs to square
ugly outside edge squirts down to short third man
short, wide but gets the wicket as a huge uppercut off the back foot flies to Shoaib Malik on the third man boundary. Extra pace from Shoaib there and he smiles as England sink further
backs away to one which pitches around leg but manages to rush out that one off the back foot over to mid-off
backs away to a slower ball which is wristily flicked out to point
backs away and creates too much room, ending up fishing and swishing at one which flies wide of off stump
Straight yorker. The batsman steps away yet again and Shoaib gets the reward for a tidy piece of bowling with one that crashes into the bottom of middle and leg stump
fishes at that one and leaves it alone
Gough gets a huge cheer for those two runs which he picks up through an on-drive
the batsman does well to leave that one which sails down the channel and arcs nicely away
fresh-air pull shot and the batsman misses that one completely; it flies through to Akmal
hip-high full toss is driven on the up to mid-on
driven to cover
attempted yorker, dug out
huge heave off the back foot with a big follow-through and that flies through backward point.
waited for that one and picked the back behind point
another big loft - this time off a slower ball and that flies over into space at to cow corner
took his eyes off that bouncer and pulled it right behind him - it flew right over the keeper's head, just bouncing inside the line. Gough is not messing around here
slower ball, well dug out
ooh, how did that one miss? That just missed the off stump and that's a great way to finish his spell
pushed off the back foot to cover
helps that off the back foot to third man
a huge shout for lbw but the batsmen run through for a quick single
pulled off the back foot
guided down to third man
hit to point
guided behind point
dug out off the front foot to square
slapped unconvincingly to square
slower ball hit into the covers
strayed down leg
slower delivery pops up harmlessly into the covers
wide down the off-side, Broad gamely reaches for that one
beautiful cover drive to bring up England's 200
leg-side wide there
hit out to long-on
Gough tries another big heave there off one which was going down leg and that goes straight down long-on's throat

inn2.comm: oooh lovely ball to start with, swinging away but it's neatly timed by the batsman to long-on
it'd down the leg side, Read somehow fails to take it and it races down for five wides
better line from Gough this time, defended on the front foot
too straight and whipped away past square leg with a flick of the wrists. Stuart Broad does well to save four - the rain helping his sliding stop
good ball on off stump, hitting the splice of Hafeez's bat. It lands short of point
a cracking ball outside the off stump, enticing the batsman forward and passing his outside edge by a hair's width
cuts this back into Hafeez
and he starts with a wide outside the off stump
excellent ball, full and straight - jagging back into the right hander just a touch - and forcing the right hander forward
very well bowled jagging back markedly into the right hander, almost cutting him in half
again this cuts back but it's landed too straight and therefore jags back too much, down the leg side
outside off stump and left alone

Cuts this back into Malik and raps him on the pad, Broad races down the pitch and nearly forgets to appeal to the umpire...but he eventually does, and Malik is given his marching orders. Superbly bowled from Broad - a wicket in his first one-day over
and he's rapped on the pads again but it's going over the top
pushed through midwicket
swinging into the right hander who plays it neatly to mid-off
too short, too straight and it's helped around the corner, fairly racing away down to fine leg
straying down the leg side again
that's much better from Gough, outside the off stump and forcing the batsman to think about it. Hafeez goes back and pushes it out into the covers
oooh! Drops just short of first slip as Hafeez edges this beautiful away swinger
short and it's pushed into the leg side for a scampered single
full and swinging into the right hander who punches it back past the bowler
full once more and driven, without timing, into the covers
short and outside the off stump, angled by the batsman down to third man. Expertly played but Broad generated some impressive bounce there
yorker length and timed to short extra cover, the crowd cheer...but it's a bump ball
left alone outside the off stump
defended on the back foot
full and straight, defended on the front foot
lovely ball from Gough causing indecision from the batsman who plays this, with his bat away from his body, down to third man. Played it very well, actually
blocked out on the front foot
a fraction too short and Hafeez plays a short-arm pull over midwicket! A brilliant shot, in the style of Michael Vaughan (if that helps you visualise it). Fine shot
short again but played down to third man for two this time
edged but short of third slip this time. Gough isn't yet apoplectic but he's fairly fuming...like a Welsh dragon
oh, well bowled! Well left, too, by the batsman as it nips back and he shoulders arms
too full, driving length and Younis simply drives through the line with class. Super shot
and he absolutely flays this but straight to point. My word he gave that some humpty, and quite a bit of dumpty too
the bouncer - a useful one too, short and straight and Younis mis-hooks it, top edging it down to fine leg but Gough can't make the ground and it bobbles over the line for four
outside off this time and left alone
rapped on the pad but it's not out
driven without timing into the covers
too straight from Gough, worked to square leg but there's no run on offer
driven (clunked) off the back foot
good bouncer from Gough, the batsman gets a top edge but it sails over the wicketkeeper and down for four
shot! Smacked off the back foot behind square, in the air, and it torpedoes for four
excellent ball to finish the over, cutting the batsman in half
